page.title: 06BUILDINGS IN GT. BROMLEY
page.content: Our survey of 50{buildings,}dating from the late 1600's to the mid 1970's, showed that many had been renovated. There were 26 houses - 3 terraced, 17 bungalows,1 church,1 shop and 1 pub. The most popular{building {material}was brick,rendered and then painted,some used breeze blocks,a few brick only and 1 house was wooden. Many had tiled {roofs,}often man- made ,a few used slates or abestos.All houses had{chimneys}and most had television aerials.{Window}types included Georgian,dormer,casement, picture and sash.Most{doors}were wooden and some metal. There were 21 garages,10 sheds and 4 green houses.Most had small front {gardens}and large back{gardens depending on plot size and the age of the property.
